=C2=A0
Ahmed.

--- On Sat, 12/26/09, a=
nas elghafari <anas.elghafari@...> wrote:


From: anas elghafari <ana=
s.elghafari@...>
Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] How to start a job wi=
thout using the Web UI?
To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
Date: Saturday,=
 December 26, 2009, 6:16 PM


=C2=A0 



Take a look at section 2.2 in the =
user manuel. You can start heritrix from the command line with the option -=
-nowui. but you have to give it Crawl settings in an XML file. (The web ui =
generates such an XML file for each job and stores it in the directory of t=
hat job. So maybe you can get one of those XML order files and edit them an=
d then feed them to the heritrix --nowui)






On Sat, Dec 26, 2009 at 5:5=
2 PM, Ahmed Salleh <ahmed_salleh@ yahoo.com> wrote:


=C2=A0 



I am curre=
ntly running a website (www.kidzdomain. org) that allows a user to type a U=
RL in a given textbox and my Java program will validate the content of the =
website. I want to use Heritrix ver. 1.14.3 but I do not want to use the We=
b UI to start a job. 

Can I start a job (user's URI)in Heritrix to crawl t=
he site without using the Web UI? If I can, what are the possible ways of m=
e doing that?

I will use my program to show the result after the harvest i=
n my website.

Thank you.

Ahmed.

<DIV>Take a look at section 2.2 in the use=
r manuel. You can start heritrix from the command line with the option --no=
wui. but you have to give it Crawl settings in an XML file. (The web ui gen=
erates such an XML file for each job and stores it in the directory of that=
 job. So maybe you can get one of those XML order files and edit them and t=
hen feed them to the heritrix --nowui)
<DIV><BR></DIV>
<DIV><BR>
